When locale is not initialized, skip setlocale

When locale is not initialized, locale.setlocale(locale.LC_ALL, '') fails.
In that case, just skip setlocale process. Fixes #93

use sys.exit instead of exit from site module

exit() from site module is useful in interactive repl and should no be used in
programs.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html#exit

Signed-off-by: JChien <jeffchien13@gmail.com>
Add C-m to default keybindings; Fix #81
Do curses.nonl() to distinguish between "RET" and "C-j"; Close #80

Fix buffer-related TypeError in Python3; Close #78

In Python3, buffer object (like tty) don't receive
string (six.text_type) but receive bytes, which can be obtained by
`text.encode(encoding)`.

Update README.md

Version 0.1.0

- Supports Python 3
- Add a match method 'pinin'
- Add an option -v, which inverts matches as in grep
- Now percol displays runtime errors to screen
- Use `python-cmigemo` for C/Migemo feature (Frees uses from installing
- the extra package C/Migemo native Python extension)
Add a feature to guess migemo's dictionary path
No extra spaces around CLI messages
Raise error if a specified input file is not readable
Use error_message() to construct error message
Add a method to construct error message
Don't shelve exception in migemo finder

Suppress six not found error in installation process

Since percol now depends on six, importing percol module in setup.py (to
use version and docstring in percol module) causes six not found
error. We avoid this trap by extracting version and docstring
information into separate file (info.py) and just 'exec' it in setup.py.

Merge pull request #49 from ChickenProp/master

Allow running as a symlink.

Allow running as a symlink.

If the `percol` executable is a symlink, `abspath` returns the directory
containing the link, while `realpath` returns the directory containing
the target. So now I can create

    local/bin/percol -> local/src/percol/bin/percol

and I don't need local/src/percol/bin in my $PATH.

such as `debug.py`(https://github.com/narfdotpl/debug)

- `--right-prompt`

Consider 8 (ASCII) as backspace in all platforms

Reference: https://github.com/jonas/tig/pull/10
Extract percol specific logic from lazyarray

Allow users to set default prompt- and results-settings in rc.py

If they omit prompt- and results-related command line options, values
specified in rc.py are used.
Bring back load path manipulation to bin/percol
Command line option's document should be begun with a small-case letter.

Results can be displayed in bottom-up fashion (closes #9)

An option `--result-bottom-up` makes two changes:

  (1) display results bottom-up fashion, and
  (2) reverse line movement command behavior.

Another option `--prompt-bottom` let percol to display the prompt
bottom of the screen.
Hold finder's attribute per instance, instead of per class

Move a bunch of codes in bin/percol to percol/cli.py (refs #8)

This change makes percol easier to be used as a python module

model.select_index() try select specified index optimistically

Now model.select_index(-1) works for LazyArray

Fix model.select_bottom() behavior in lazy mode

model.select_bottom() now eagerly pulls results and select the actual
last item correctly, instead of the partially fetched result's last
one.
LazyArray supports negative index and pull_all() method

Fix: When case_insensitive is true and query is uppercase, nothing will be matched.
Set 1 to exit code when user canceled percol.

Added option --peep

When --peep is specified, percol exits immediately with doing nothing,
which allows you to cache module files onto page cache and speed up start-up time.

Use modern expression for command substitution in README.md

Generally, $(foo) is preferred to `foo` in modern shells.

Make default setting feasible

Before this commit, there is no way to execute action
since `RET` key code is never sent in ordinary terminal
while `C-j` is sent instead.

Decode rc file to unicode. Use compiled regexp.

Fixed behavior of display_len for non-unicode string. Accept initial query and caret position in Percol constructor.

Previously, display_len returns len(s) no matter `beg` or `end` is given when s is non-unicode string.
